This test ensures we can check if an entered value is valid, if a pattern attribute is specified to do the validation.

!define HTML_INPUT_VALIDATION { {{{
<html>
<body>
<form>
<label for='name'>Name</label>
<input type='text' id='name' name='aName' pattern='[A-Za-z]{2,30}'/>
<input type='submit' value='ok'/>
</form>
</body>
</html>}}} }

!define HTML_INPUT_NOVALIDATION { {{{
<html>
<body>
<form>
<label for='name'>Name</label>
<input type='text' id='name' name='aName'/>
<input type='submit' value='ok'/>
</form>
</body>
</html>}}} }



|script      |mock xml server setup     |
|add response|${HTML_INPUT_VALIDATION}  |
|add response|${HTML_INPUT_VALIDATION}  |
|add response|${HTML_INPUT_NOVALIDATION}|
|$url=       |get mock server url       |

|script                |browser test|
|seconds before timeout|1           |

Valid input according the pattern of 'Name'.
|script                           |
|open |$url                       |
|enter|test    |as  |Name         |
|check|value of|Name|is valid|true|

Invalid input according the pattern of 'Name'.
|script                            |
|open |$url                        |
|enter|123     |as  |Name          |
|check|value of|Name|is valid|false|

Check input of 'Name' but this time it has no pattern, so should always be valid.
|script                           |
|open |$url                       |
|enter|123     |as  |Name         |
|check|value of|Name|is valid|true|



|script|mock xml server setup|
|stop                        |
